plugins.name: QR Code Builder
plugins.description:
Transform your design experience with the QR Code Builder for Figma. This versatile plugin empowers designers to create custom, high-quality QR codes directly within Figma, enhancing your projects with seamless connectivity and aesthetic appeal.


Features:


  • Website URL Integration: Easily generate QR codes that direct users to any website URL, enhancing accessibility and user engagement.
  • Advanced Customization Options: Tailor your QR codes to perfectly match your design vision with a range of customization features:


  1. Color: Choose from an unlimited color palette to make your QR codes stand out.
  2. Style Logo: Incorporate your brand‚Äôs logo into the QR code for a cohesive and professional look.
  3. Shape: Customize the shape of your QR codes to complement your design elements.
  4. Corners: Add a unique touch by modifying the corner shapes of your QR codes.
  5. Border Style: Select from various border styles to enhance the visual appeal of your QR codes.
  6. Center Style: Apply different center styles to make your QR codes truly unique.


  • File Upload Capability: Embed files directly into your QR codes, providing users with instant access to additional content.
  • License Management: Enjoy flexibility with our free tier or upgrade to unlimited usage, ensuring continuous and unrestricted access to all features.
  • Effortless QR Code Creation: Generate high-quality QR codes with a user-friendly interface designed for efficiency and ease of use.
  • Upgrade Notifications: Stay informed about your usage limits with clear notifications, and upgrade seamlessly when needed.
  • Dedicated Customer Support: Access our support team for any assistance, including license management and troubleshooting.


Why Choose QR Code Builder?


Enhance your designs with interactive QR codes that are not only functional but also visually appealing. Whether you're directing users to a website, embedding files, or customizing the aesthetics, the QR Code Builder provides a comprehensive solution tailored to your needs.


Get Started Today!


Download and Install the QR Code Builder from the Figma Community Store and elevate your design projects with the power of customizable QR codes.
plugins.tagline: Create, Customize, and Integrate Stunning QR Codes Seamlessly with QR Code Builder for Figma.

plugins.name: Instance Randomizer
plugins.description:
Useful to rapidly explore layout options, create realistic user interfaces without the manual, hand-picked randomisation, and more. It works by by randomising component instances & their properties you define.


üöÄ Features:

  • Quick Randomization: One-click functionality for immediate results.
  • Selective Randomization: Preserve specific properties from randomising.
  • Variants & Boolean Support: Compatible with these component properties.
  • Ignores non-instance layers: So you can avoid hand-picking instances and just quickly randomize in bulk, the plugin will skip over non-instance elements & layers.


‚ñ∂Ô∏è How it works + examples (100 seconds)

plugins.name: Follow the Path
plugins.description:
üß≠ FOLLOW THE PATH

A Figma plugin that automatically arranges objects along a vector path with customizable spacing and orientation options.


üéØ FEATURES


üß© Simple Path Selection

  1. Select any vector path to use as a guide for object placement.


üß± Multiple Object Support

  1. Arrange one or many objects along your selected path.


üß† Auto-Detection

  1. The plugin automatically detects both path and objects in your selection.


üìè Flexible Spacing

  1. Auto interval: Distributes objects evenly along the path
  2. Manual interval: Set exact pixel spacing between objects


‚öôÔ∏è Advanced Controls

  1. Rotate objects to follow the path's direction
  2. Measure from center of objects (optional)
  3. Align objects to start, center, or end of path


üßë‚Äçüíª HOW TO USE


  1. Select a vector path, or select both the path and objects
  2. Configure spacing and alignment preferences
  3. Click ‚ÄúDistribute‚Äù to apply


üî¨ TECHNICAL DETAILS

  1. Works with any valid vector path
  2. Optimized for performance with large selections
  3. Smart algorithm for precise placement


üöß BETA NOTICE & KNOWN ISSUES

This is a beta version. Feedback is welcome ‚Äî future updates may follow based on interest and available time.


‚ö†Ô∏è Known issue:

Native Figma shapes (such as ellipses, stars, and polygons) may incorrectly define the starting point of the path after being edited or used in boolean operations. This can lead to inaccurate object placement.


‚úÖ How to fix:

Copy the shape as SVG and paste it back into the canvas ‚Äî this will convert it into a clean vector path.

Additionally, you can manually inspect and adjust the nodes if needed.
plugins.tagline: Arrange objects along any vector path with flexible spacing and rotation options.

plugins.name: SVG Sprite Maker
plugins.description:
Description

The SVG Sprite and TypeScript Enum Generator plugin for Figma helps streamline your workflow by automating the process of converting SVG icons into a single sprite sheet and generating corresponding TypeScript enum code. This plugin is designed for developers and designers who want to optimize their projects with efficient SVG handling and seamless TypeScript integration.


Features

SVG Sprite Generation: Automatically compile multiple SVG icons into a single sprite sheet.

TypeScript Enum Generation: Generate TypeScript enum code corresponding to the SVG icons for easy reference in your codebase.

User-friendly Interface: Intuitive and easy-to-use interface for quick and efficient sprite and enum generation.


How to use


// SVGIcons.tsx
type SVGIconProps = {
icon: SVGIcons
width: number
height: number
active: boolean
}

/**
* Renders an SVG icon.
* The SVGSprite.tsx file must be declared at the top level of the project page.
* @param {SVGIcons} props.icon - The name of the icon to render.
* @param {number} props.width - The width of the SVG element.
* @param {number} props.height - The height of the SVG element.
* @returns {JSX.Element} The rendered SVG icon.
*/
const SVGIcon = ({
icon,
width,
height,
...rest // Rest operator to capture additional props
}: Partial<SVGIconProps>): JSX.Element => {
return (
<svg height={height} width={width} {...rest}>
<use
height={height}
href={`#${icon}`}
width={width}
xlinkHref={`#${icon}`}
/>
</svg>
)
}
export default SVGIcon

// SVGSprite.tsx
export enum SVGIcons {
SAMPLE_ICON = 'sample_icon',
}

const SVGSprite = () => {
return (
<svg style={{ display: 'none' }} xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
<defs>
<symbol
height="24"
id="sample_icon"
viewBox="0 0 24 24"
width="24"
>
<path
d="M17.6 4H6.4C5 4 4 5 4 6.4V17.6C4 19 5 20 6.4 20H17.6C19 20 20 19 20 17.6V6.4C20 5 19 4 17.6 4Z"
fill="white"
/>
<path
clipRule="evenodd"
d="M6.4 2H17.6C20.1 2 22 3.9 22 6.4V17.6C22 20.1 20.1 22 17.6 22H6.4C3.9 22 2 20.1 2 17.6V6.4C2 3.9 3.9 2 6.4 2ZM6.4 4H17.6C19 4 20 5 20 6.4V17.6C20 19 19 20 17.6 20H6.4C5 20 4 19 4 17.6V6.4C4 5 5 4 6.4 4Z"
fill="#E5E8EB"
fillRule="evenodd"
/>
<circle cx="15.75" cy="8.5" fill="#FFC342" r="2" />
<path
d="M11.27 11.25C11.66 10.84 12.31 10.84 12.71 11.25L17.51 16.23C17.97 16.71 17.63 17.5 16.97 17.5H7C6.34 17.5 6 16.71 6.46 16.23L11.27 11.25Z"
fill="#03B26C"
/>
</symbol>
</defs>
</svg>
)
}

export default SVGSprite

// use
// Before using the <SVGIcon /> component, you must first call the <SVGSprite /> component in the global scope.
<SVGIcon height={20} icon={SVGIcons.SAMPLE_ICON} width={20} />
plugins.tagline: SVG Sprite and TypeScript Enum Generator

plugins.name: Swap Instance
plugins.description:
This is a simple little plugin that allows you to select a source instance and apply it to a destination instance (in the same way the swap instance panel works) but also optionally preserving some of the of the overrides.


This is a game changer when working with slots to allow you to insert a configured instance into an existing slot without having to manually reconfigure it.


How to use it.

  1. Select an instance or a component layer.
  2. Press the middle + button to "copy" the layer
  3. Select where you would like to "paste" the instance
  4. Press the right replace button


Settings

  • Persistent? Keeps the panel open after pasting
  • Create? If the source layer is not a component, the plugin will create a component of it when pasting
  • Deep Copy? This will attempt to copy any overrides on the source instance
plugins.tagline: Swap instances in the canvas while preserving overrides

plugins.name: SSelect
plugins.description:
Make quick selections in Quick Actions. ‚ú®


Extending the built in "Select all with ..." commands and without the need to open ui, all happens in Quick Actions!


‚ú® New:

  • Select with same text content
  • Select child
  • Select sibling
  • Select root


üÄÑ Core:

  • Select with conditions
  • Search and select


üéØ Select with conditions:

Select nodes with same types, names, or main components becomes few keys away.


Root:

  • Select root item (new)

Instance:

  • Select all instances within parent item
  • Select all instances within root item
  • Select all instances

Type:

  • Select all with same type within parent item
  • Select all with same type within root item
  • Select all with same type

Name:

  • Select all with same name within parent item
  • Select all with same name within root item
  • Select all with same name

Text content: (new)

  • Select all with same text content within parent item
  • Select all with same text content within root item
  • Select all with same text content

Child: (new)

  • Select first child
  • Select last child
  • Select target order

Sibling: (new)

  • Select prev sibling
  • Select next sibling


üîç Search and Select:

Search within selection or in page for deeply nested nodes, using filter to make the search more easily to select.


Filter type

  • All
  • Frame
  • Component
  • Component set
  • Group
  • Slice
  • Media
  • Text
  • Vector
  • Rectangle
  • Ellipse
  • Polygon
  • Star
  • Line
  • Sticky
  • Section
  • Stamp
  • Connector
  • Widget
  • Shape with text

Search by name

  • Group by appearance amount


‚ùì Suggestion

Leave a comment or email for suggestions, cheers.

This plugin was designed mostly for personal use, but if you'd like to expand upon it feel free to create a fork on GitHub: https://github.com/camdotod/resize-by-percent-figma-plugin

How it Works:

  1. Select at least one object

  3. Click "Resize"


üî≤Objects with Parents

If the object is inside another container it will resize based on the parent dimensions .

The object will resize based on its own dimensions.

plugins.name: Figma CSS Variables
plugins.description:
Effortlessly export your Figma variables to CSS. Git deployment is coming soon!


Questions & Support


üí¨ Figma CSS Variables is new and we welcome your feedback.


If you notice any bugs or have any questions about the plugin, please feel free to reach out to us directly via GitHub Discussions, and we'll do our best to help you troubleshoot and resolve them as quickly as possible.


You can also report issues or suggest features on GitHub Issues.


Features


Export & Sync


  1. Analyze your variables View all Figma variable collections and modes
  2. Instant CSS generation Preview and export CSS from your variables
  3. Flexible export options Copy CSS directly or download all generated CSS files
  4. One-click synchronization Always stay up to date with your latest Figma variables
  5. When exporting, a ZIP file is generated with all the CSS files at the root level


Deploy to Git (Premium feature)


This feature allows you to automatically deploy your generated CSS variable files to Git for seamless design‚Äìcode collaboration.


Unlock Git deployment by purchasing a license via Stripe.


- Connect to GitHub, GitLab, or a self-hosted GitLab instance

- Select multiple collections & modes to deploy in a single commit

- Commit messages are automatically pre-filled based on your selection

- Branches are customizable and automatically created if they do not exist

- Customize the target directory for your CSS files using the "basePath" parameter

- Simplify collaboration between design and development


Git Integration & Security


You can easily manage your Git providers by:


- Adding a new provider

- Editing the settings of an existing provider

- Deleting a provider if it's no longer needed


When saving a Git provider, the following fields are available:

"token", "owner", "repository", "branch", "basePath" and "host" (for self-hosted GitLab).


Your Git provider details are stored locally on your machine for privacy and security.


File structure


  1. A separate CSS file is generated for each mode within a collection
  2. Files follow the naming pattern: "collectionName-modeName.css"


Variable transformations


Figma variables are transformed to ensure they are valid in CSS:


  1. Slashes ("/") and spaces are replaced with hyphens ("-") in variable names
  2. Original casing of variable names is preserved (uppercase, lowercase, etc.)
  3. For numeric variables ("FLOAT" type), the unit "px" is automatically added
  4. CSS variables are sorted alphabetically


UI & Accessibility


  1. Dark mode compatible: the plugin adapts to the user's Figma theme preference (light/dark mode)
  2. Keyboard navigation: all interactive elements support keyboard navigation for improved accessibility
  3. Focus indicators: clear visual focus on form fields and interactive elements
  4. Accessibility compliance: designed following W3C and A11Y best practices


How to use


Exporting CSS Variables


  1. Navigate to the Export tab
  2. View all Figma variables structured into collections and modes (a collection contains multiple modes)
  3. Select a collection and a mode
  4. Preview the generated CSS
  5. Copy the generated CSS directly to your clipboard or download all CSS files


Deploying to Git (Premium feature)


- Purchase a license via Stripe and enter it in the Settings tab

- Add a Git provider from the Settings tab

- Choose a provider from the available options (GitHub, GitLab)

- Fill in the required details in the configuration modal

- Save the provider settings

- Next, go to the Deploy tab and select a provider from the list

- Use the multiple selection dropdown to choose the modes you wish to deploy

- Click Push to deploy the corresponding CSS files to Git


Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è by @yoriiis.
plugins.tagline: Export Figma variables to CSS and deploy directly to Git for seamless design‚Äìcode collaboration

plugins.name: Find all instances and export
plugins.description:
The "Find All Component Instances" plugin is your new dev handoff tool for easily getting the all components you use in any page in Figma. This plugin enables you to easily search, list, and differentiate between instances within your projects.


Key features include:


Instance Detection: Automatically scan and find all instances of components in the current page or selected screens.


Component Differentiation: Use tags like [ds-component] and [ds-atom] in your component descriptions to filter and differentiate design system components.


Search Functionality: Quickly search for components within the current page or across selected screens.


Export to CSV: Export the list of component instances, including details like type, source, and design system status, to a CSV file for further analysis and reporting.


Selection and Highlighting: Easily select and highlight instances in your design to review and manage them effectively.


Whether you're maintaining a large design system or working on a smaller project, this plugin helps you list down all components that you use in any page you are in.


I'd love to hear your thoughts! If you enjoy using the plugin, please take a moment to leave me a review and share your feedback.
plugins.tagline: Eeasily list/export the all components you use in any page in Figma

plugins.name: Language Variables
plugins.description:
This plugin seamlessly integrates with Figma, enabling you to import translation files directly into your variable collections. With support for both JSON and ResX file formats, this tool is versatile enough to work with popular translation systems like Weblate, i18n, and others.


Once installed, the plugin allows you to effortlessly bring all the keys and values from your project's translation system into Figma, converting them into variables with their corresponding values and keys. This feature ensures that your design can adapt to various languages with accuracy and ease, making it an invaluable asset for creating globally accessible applications and websites.


Updating your translations is as straightforward as re-importing your updated translation file. The plugin intelligently updates the variables in Figma to reflect the latest changes, ensuring your design remains synchronized with your project's evolving linguistic requirements. This eliminates the need for manual updates, saving you time and reducing the potential for errors.


Whether you're working on a small project or a large-scale application, our plugin is designed to streamline your workflow, enhance collaboration between designers and developers, and ensure a seamless integration of multi-language support in your designs. It's the perfect tool for anyone looking to efficiently manage translations within Figma.
plugins.tagline: Instant Translation Import for Figma Designs.

plugins.name: Element Rounding
plugins.description:
Element Rounding is designed to help Figma users achieve precision in their designs by automatically converting decimal values for x, y, width, and height properties of elements to whole numbers. This ensures pixel-perfect alignment and cleaner design specs.


How to Use:


1. Install the Element Rounding plugin in your Figma account.

2. Select the elements you want to adjust in your design.

3. Run the Element Rounding plugin from the plugins menu.

4. The plugin will automatically round the x, y, width, and height values to the nearest whole numbers.


Relevant Limitations:


‚Ä¢ The plugin will only adjust the positional and sizing properties (x, y, width, height) and will not modify other properties.

‚Ä¢ For designs relying on precise decimal placements for unique visual effects, using this plugin may alter the intended look.

‚Ä¢ Users should ensure to review the changes made by the plugin to confirm it aligns with their design intent.
plugins.tagline: Precision Tweaker for Figma, converting decimal values of x, y, width, and height to whole numbers.

MockMaster AI was crafted to generate mock data that perfectly fits narrow workflows and real-world scenarios where data isn't always available. Whether you need company-specific details, app-related information, or something entirely unique, this tool uses AI to create it for you. And don‚Äôt worry‚Äîit's currently free, until i drain my savings.


It also has tons of pre-filled data which can be generated by selecting any number of text frames.

  1. Select any text layers.

plugins.name: GeneXus Design Assistant
plugins.description:
GeneXus Design Assistant is a revolutionary Figma plugin that seamlessly integrates with GeneXus using Generative Artificial Intelligence, allowing you to accelerate and optimize the application design process. With GeneXus Design Assistant, you can generate a fully functional application, leveraging the modeling capabilities and the power of GeneXus and GeneXus Next.


Optimizing the design process


GeneXus Design Assistant is aimed at designers who want to turn vibrant ideas into cutting-edge digital products without requiring programming skills.


The benefits include:


üöÄ Rapid Prototyping and Testing: Quickly validate assumptions, explore alternatives, and develop functional MVPs, leveraging the robust capabilities of Generative Artificial Intelligence models, modeling in Figma, and GeneXus.


‚ú® Improved Communication and Collaboration: Designs and ideas are shared in real-time throughout the company, aligning interdisciplinary considerations into a shared vision of success.


üõ†Ô∏è Scalable and Maintainable Solutions: Facilitates responding to the exact needs of a constantly evolving business environment, all through a unified and future-proof platform.


üì± Democratization of Design: Reduces bottlenecks by involving non-specialized team members at various project levels, fostering innovation, and streamlining workflows.


What is the GeneXus Design Assistant project?


GeneXus Design Assistant is a public Figma plugin, serving as an innovative assistant for application design. With GeneXus Design Assistant, designers can expedite the collaborative creation of software experiences, keeping a keen focus on end users. Functioning as a comprehensive assistant within Figma, GeneXus Design Assistant guides designers through the process of conceptualizing, designing, and prototyping web and mobile applications using Generative Artificial Intelligence.


GeneXus Design Assistant makes this possible by generating design from a data model and example data, both sourced from a GeneXus knowledge base, and utilizing a predefined, customizable design system. The generated design has the advantage of being importable into GeneXus, ensuring a seamless integration with the platform and allowing the creative process to easily translate into a functional software product.


USAGE


Please refer to GeneXus Design Assistant for Figma.


SUPPORT


Your thoughts, ideas, and suggestions for improvement are welcome and highly valued. Connect with us at GeneXus Support.

accepted.name: GeneXus DesignOps Team
accepted.description: GeneXus workspace specialized in integrating design into GeneXus knowledge base.

plugins.tagline: Plugin that seamlessly integrates with GeneXus using Generative Artificial Intelligence

plugins.name: A11y Text
plugins.description:
A11y Text evaluates the contrast ratio between text and its background to ensure compliance with WCAG 2.1 AA and AAA guidelines.


It checks text size (small text under 18px or bold text under 14px) and large text (18px or larger, or 14px bold), verifying minimum contrast ratios of 4.5:1 for small text and 3:1 for large text (AA), and 7:1 for small text and 4.5:1 for large text (AAA).
plugins.tagline: Enhance readability, ensure accessibility.

plugins.name: Local Variables to Tailwind & CSS
plugins.description:
Easily export your Figma color tokens into Tailwind config and CSS variables with this plugin.


Features

  1. Multiple Collections: Organize tokens across various projects effortlessly.
  2. Nested Folders: Support for deeper folder structures within your design system.
  3. Cross-Collection References: Reuse and link tokens across different collections.
  4. Multi-Color Space Support: Export colors in multiple formats (e.g., RGB, HSL).
  5. Output Formats:
  6. CSS File: All Figma variables compiled as CSS variables.
  7. JSON File: Color tokens optimized for Tailwind configuration.


Version

This is a beta release, offering a first look at these features with further enhancements planned. Ideal for teams building modular, cross-platform design systems.

plugins.name: WeaveFox.ai - AI Powered Figma/Image to Code (React, Vue, AntdÔºå& more)
plugins.description:
WeaveFox is an intelligent front-end development platform designed for the AI era. Built upon the Ant Bailing multimodal large model, it can directly generate front-end source code from design mockups, delivering a development experience characterized by high quality, efficiency, and productivity. The platform currently supports various mainstream application types, including enterprise-level back-office systems, mobile H5 pages, mini-programs, and mobile card-based applications.

Core Features

Image-to-Code

Description: The Image-to-Code feature uses multimodal recognition technology to convert images or design drafts into front-end source code, suitable for multiple endpoints. It supports back-office systems, mini-programs, mobile cards, and other application types, meeting the responsive layout needs of different devices.

Highlights:

  1. Adapts to multiple application types, including back-office systems, mini-programs, and mobile platforms
  2. Generates complete code structures directly from design mockups or screenshots, improving development efficiency

Multi-Technology Stack Support

Description: The multi-end code generation capability allows users to flexibly generate code for multiple platforms based on a single asset, thereby accommodating a variety of application scenarios. This significantly enhances code reuse and reduces repetitive workload. The feature supports React, Vue, Ant Design, Element UI, and card-based technology stacks.

Highlights:

  1. Generate multi-end code from a single source
  2. Improve code reuse and adapt to various endpoints and layouts

Automatic Design Partitioning

Description: The automatic page partitioning feature intelligently segments an entire design page into modular code assets. Each generated code block can be independently exported, making it well-suited for modular management and reuse in projects.

Highlights:

  1. Automatically divides an entire page into manageable code blocks
  2. Supports independent export of each code block

Semantics and Reusability

Description:

  1. The "Repeat" recognition feature automatically identifies repetitive or similar UI elements within the code and optimizes them during code generation, reducing redundancy and improving code quality and maintainability.
  2. Loop extraction for structured repetition.
  3. High-order component extraction for enhanced encapsulation.

Highlights:

  1. Identifies similar and repeated UI components
  2. Automatically optimizes repetitive code to streamline and simplify codebases

Automatic Image Cutting & Upload

Description:

  1. The automatic image cutting and upload feature detects image components within the generated code and automatically slices and uploads them. This greatly reduces manual cutting tasks, making the development process more seamless.
  2. Automatic icon recognition and matching.

Highlights:

  1. Automatically identifies and slices image areas, then uploads them
  2. Eliminates manual image slicing operations, saving time

Convenient Export & Integration

Description: The code export feature enables flexible exporting or copying of generated code, allowing users to easily integrate code assets into their development projects. Multiple export formats are provided, facilitating integration with different technology stacks. Integration with code repository services also enables one-click merge request creation.

Highlights:

  1. Supports flexible code export or copying
  2. Adapts to various technology stacks and project requirements

Asset Management

Description: The asset library function stores and manages generated code assets in a centralized manner. Users can view, adjust, and export generated code from the asset library. Each generated code snippet or UI element is treated as an ‚Äúasset‚Äù that can be edited, regenerated, and flexibly exported as needed. This makes it easy to refine and re-edit code assets on demand.

Highlights:

  1. Provides a unified code management space
  2. Supports viewing, modifying, and exporting code assets for reuse
  3. Allows multiple edits and regenerations of each asset
  4. Offers flexible code export for project integration
plugins.tagline: Generate code from Figma design files with AI

plugins.name: Pushed.ai - Figma to Klaviyo
plugins.description:
Try Pushed Out In Our Playground File


Streamline Your Email Workflow with Our Figma-to-Klaviyo Plugin


Simplify email development by exporting production-ready HTML directly from Figma to Klaviyo. Say goodbye to switching between tools‚Äînow you can design, configure, and build beautiful, responsive emails all in one place. Whether you're working on email templates or full campaigns, our plugin helps you spend less time navigating Klaviyo and more time creating.


How the Plugin Works:

  1. Design in Figma: Start by crafting your email design using frames and components in Figma.
  2. Sync with Klaviyo: Effortlessly link your Klaviyo account and configure your campaign with built-in audience and account selection features.
  3. Configure Campaign Details: Add campaign names, audience segments, subject lines, preview text directly in the plugin.
  4. Optimize for Responsiveness: Automatically pull alt text from Figma frames and easily configure URLs for each frame to ensure accessibility and responsiveness.
  5. Export to Klaviyo: With one click, export your email template or campaign to Klaviyo, fully ready to schedule and send.


Key Benefits‚Ä®

Stay Inside Figma‚ÄîNo Switching Tools

Our plugin keeps you inside Figma, allowing you to handle everything from design to export. No need for back-and-forth between Figma and Klaviyo‚Äîdesign, configure, and export all in one seamless workflow.


Seamless Klaviyo Integration

Quickly integrate with your Klaviyo account to manage multiple accounts and campaigns without ever leaving Figma. Set up your email campaigns in just a few clicks.


Responsive & Accessible by Design

Exported emails are automatically mobile-friendly and accessible. Our plugin pulls alt text directly from your Figma frames and uses HTML to enhance readability for screen readers, ensuring your emails are optimized for all devices and email clients.


Efficient Campaign Setup

Configure every aspect of your email campaigns‚Äîfrom audience lists to subject lines‚Äîand export HTML directly into Klaviyo. With unnecessary steps cut out, you can create professional emails in minutes instead of hours.


Designed for Creators, Loved by Marketers

We understand both design and marketing. Our plugin is built to support you in creating stunning, effective emails quickly and easily‚Äîwithout compromising on creativity or functionality.


Get Support from:

For any questions, reach out to us at support@pushed.ai
plugins.tagline: Design, optimize, and export stunning emails from Figma to Klaviyo‚Äîseamlessly and effortlessly.

Page over is a Figma plugin simplifying your handoff workflow and helping everyone find what they are looking for in your file.


Sort things out from A to Z or the other way around for finding what your are looking for faster. Or add a number to every page and point out the exact numbered page, no matter how many pages you have.


To tidy up the structure and visual hierarchy you can add multiple separator pages in different ASCII styles or even create segments of pages with a click of a button.


Improve your documentation and project management by sharing links to all Pages and/or Prototype flows with a single click while respecting your file's privacy and permissions.


The complete list feature includes:


  • Sorting pages A to Z and Z to A
  • Numbering pages
  • Adding separator (blank pages) with predefined styles
  • Adding multiple pages at once (page segment) with predefined or custom colors
  • Export file anatomy to all Pages and/or Prototype flow with one click


Try the beta release and tell us what you think with a mention to @titanas

accepted.name: Stefanos
accepted.description: Making big little things with meraki.

plugins.tagline: Turnaround your handoff workflow by sorting, numbering, adding page segments. Share page links fast.

plugins.name: Translator PRO DeepL
plugins.description:
Translator PRO ‚Äì the ultimate Figma plugin that revolutionizes design localization! Translate your Figma designs seamlessly while preserving all styles associated with texts and paragraphs using our powerful algorithm.


üåê Key Features:


Preserve Styles: Our advanced algorithm ensures that your text styles and paragraph formatting stay intact during translation.


Effortless Translation: Quickly translate any free text within your Figma designs with just a few clicks.


Custom Glossaries: Add or delete glossaries to DeepL, enhancing the accuracy of your translations.


Formality Level: Tailor your translations with the ability to choose the desired formality level for your content.



üöÄ How to Use:


Install Translator PRO plugin for Figma.


Fill in the plugin account form to get started.


Create an account on DeepL and get your API key : https://www.deepl.com/pro/change-plan#developer


you can profit from 500,000 characters/month for free.


Enter your API key in the plugin settings.


Select the text layers / pages you want to translate


Choose your translation options, including glossaries and formality level (optional).


Click 'Translate' and watch as your designs get localized instantly!


‚öôÔ∏è Settings:


Customize glossaries to match your specific terminology.

Adjust formality levels to suit the tone of your content.


Streamline your design localization process with Translator PRO ‚Äì where translation meets precision, and styles are always preserved. Download now for a seamless multilingual design experience!



üëâ We offer a usage based trial , up to 10 free translations. When reaching the limit a subscription is needed ( you will be redirected to the subscription page)


üëâ We charge a 3.5$/month fee , mostly used to pay for our infrastructure , payment is handled via FastSpring.


üëâ Our backend is hosted on AWS , we don't save any user private / public data even temporarily



Showcase : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XsZBHet9vAc
plugins.tagline: Effortless Design Localization with Style Preservation

plugins.description:
Introduction

‚ÄúColor Palette Filler‚Äù allows you to quickly apply colors from a predefined palette to any selected element in Figma. Simplify your design workflow by adding vibrant colors with just a click.


Function Description

‚Ä¢Predefined color groups: 8 colors, 12 colors, 16 colors, 20 colors, 24 colors, 28 colors, 32 colors.

‚Ä¢Instantly apply selected colors to the fill of elements.

‚Ä¢User-friendly interface for quick access to your color needs.


How to Use

1.Select one or more elements in Figma.

2.Open the ‚ÄúColor Palette Filler‚Äù plugin.

3.Click on any color from the palette to apply it to the selected elements.


Notes

‚Ä¢Make sure the selected elements can accept fill properties.

‚Ä¢The plugin applies solid colors only.

plugins.name: Droplette
plugins.description:
Droplette is an AI-powered palette generator for Figma & FigJam that lets you sync your styles and colors to generate countless palette combinations.


Select from your frames

Grab some frames and Droplette will extract colors. The AI will use use these a basis for creating your unique palettes.


Sync with your styles

Sync your color styles with Droplette to inform the AI what colors it can work with, helping you keep on brand and on track.


Adjust as you go

Like your palette but want to tweak it? No problem. Adjust your generated palette to suit your needs with built-in color adjustment controls.


Redo with AI

Iterate on your palette as much as you like. Suggest colors to take forward or start again from scratch.


-------


To learn more, check out -> droplette.app


Droplette requires an API key from OpenAI to operate. Droplette is available for a one time fee.
plugins.tagline: Create palettes based on your color styles easily with Droplette, AI that works for you.

plugins.name: Nigerian Bank Logos
plugins.description:
This Figma plugin provides a searchable interface for Nigerian bank logos, allowing users to quickly find and insert official bank logos directly into their designs.


The plugin features:

  1. Search functionality to filter banks
  2. Grid and list view options
  3. SVG and image format support
  4. Auto-centered logo placement
  5. Consistent 100px height sizing
